intro: Parasystasia, commonly known as the parasystasia plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in clusters. The leaves are usually simple and alternate, with a hairy texture. Native to tropical and subtropical regions, it thrives in moist, well-drained soil. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
